title: Leonard Cohen - Poetry, Fiction & Drawings (3 books)
description:
LEONARD COHEN (b. 1934) is a Canadian singer-songwriter, musician, poet, and novelist.  His work is known and loved throughout the world.  Numerous tribute albums, in many languages, have celebrated his songs.

THE FAVOURITE GAME (1963), Cohen's first novel, boldly etches the youth and early manhood of Lawrence Breavman, only son of an old Jewish family in Montreal.

BOOK OF MERCY (1984), a classic book of contemporary psalms, was reissued in 2010.

BOOK OF LONGING (2006), a collection of previously unpublished poetry and drawings, was written mostly written at a Zen monastery on Mount Baldy in California, where Cohen lived from 1994 to 1999, and in India, which he visited regularly during the late 1990s.


The following books are in EPUB format:

* BOOK OF LONGING (Penguin, 2006).

* BOOK OF MERCY (1984; McClelland & Stewart, 2010).

* THE FAVOURITE GAME (1963; McClelland & Stewart, 2000).
